title: Falls of Shin Walk Route

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Playground at the Falls of Shin Visitor Centre
images.caption: Playground at the Falls of Shin Visitor Centre. A popular tourist destination in Sutherland. In addition to the cafe, shop and playground at the visitor centre, and the Falls themselves, there are a number of forest walks starting from here.

images.title: Dalejohn31, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Visitor Centre

images.title: Paul Hermans, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Falls view.

images.title: Dr Richard Murray / Viewing Platform, Falls of Shin
images.caption: Viewing Platform. Salmon were attempting to leap the falls, but the river was in spate and none succeeded while we were there.

images.title: Christine Matthews / Salmon Leaping at the Falls of Shin, Sutherland
images.caption: A leaping Salmon at the falls. The strength of these fish is amazing as they leap against the torrent of water.

images.title: Graeme Smith / Forest clearing
images.caption: Forest clearing. The track meanders close to the boundary between grid squares in this area. The clearing and a couple of path intersections allow an accurate location though.

description: This circular walk visits the beautiful Falls of Shin in the north of Scotland. The picturesque falls are located on the River Shin, near the Kyle of Sutherland and the villages of Lairg and Bonar Bridge. The walk starts from the visitor centre and car park. From here it's a short walk to the viewing platform where you can enjoy an excellent view down to the falls where Salmon can be seen leaping during the late summer months. After viewing the falls head west and you can enjoy the circular woodland walk through the Shin Forest. The visitor centre houses a shop and a cafe where you can enjoy some post walk refreshments.
